reviews.review:
If I'm gonna write a review of Half-Life 2, I'm [i]gonna[/i] write a review of Half-Life 2. So here we go (oh and spoilers, but its not like the plot is anything worth plugging your ears over)



Half-Life 2 is a masterpiece. No doubt about it. Even watching my dad play it as a kid I always took note of it as a very special game. With the levels of nostalgia I had for this game, and the amount of shooting I did in G-Mod, I felt right at home. Which leads me into the game play, which is, pretty good. When you click on the button bullets come out, and the bullets hurt people when they hit them, so no points taken off in the shooting. Freeman is fun to control and everything is just solidly made, no complains besides me being conditioned by more boring shooters to press right-mouse for iron-sights and I instead shooting my alternate fire but that's not a game play complaint in the slightest. But that's not all the game play has to offer, which leads into the level design, which is some of the best in the class! Everything is so smartly designed and the level of creativity on display is jaw dropping at times coming from a game in 2004. Its ironic that ravenholm was the one level I passed off to my dad out of fear, because that was absolutely the highlight of the game next to the airboat chase and beach rides! The tension and fear caused by the horrifying sights and sounds, with headcrabs and fast zombies keeping me on my toes. The palpable tension of watching every corner of your vision for a fast zombie, while the cart or the elevator slowly rides towards you is just *chef's kiss*. The sequence is one of my favorites of all time! it was all great!... up until a point.

I don't know if this is a controversial take or not, but the fight leading up to the Citadel gates was nothing but a chore. The snipers were awful, the AI partners that insist on following you have the intelligence of a dead salmon, and always block the narrow corridors you have to navigate. I wish I could murder them, but [i]nooo[/i] I can't murder innocent civilians. The strider battles were also a chore, having my rocket circle around and blow me up instead of the giant spider robot made me want to quit during the home stretch. it felt like the masterful level design Valve prides itself in was thrown out the window. I would say the game would be nothing but improved if Dr. Kleiner teleported you to the point where you and Barney raid the Nexus building. And all that extra development time could have been put towards fleshing out the mid game, or putting lost coast or the cut ship into the game. It could have made the subpar plot much less bare bones.

This I [i]definitely[/i] know is a hot take, but the plot is nothing special. The [i]story[/i] is good, but the plot isnt. The characters and acting are what carry the game.  Its just "By jimminy crikey goodness gosh! Its Morton Keelman! You gotta hurry over to _______! _____ are waiting for you!" to string together setpeice after setpeice. I saw everything coming from miles and miles away, and despised all the "serious" cut scenes because again the characters are what really carried the game. Barney, Kleiner, and all the other little side NPCs filled me with nothing but delight. The vordigaunts that apologize for talking in their language and will only use it if they want to trash talk you made me fly back laughing. The overall story of Half-Life however is pretty good. It excels at subtle storytelling through its locations, world building, and player observation. One that sticks out to me is the fact that it's been 20 years of sexual suppression and there are dozens of discarded toys and rusted playgrounds. Or the fact that a lot of the harbors have no water, after the combine drained a lot of it away. But again the overall plot, where things happen with characters, leaves a lot to be desired.

Besides that, the game looks great, controls great, and sounds great. I enjoyed my time and feel like most others will too. But while I do feel like its a masterpiece, it has a lot of growing pains that don't come from it aging poorly.
What can be said about Half-Life 2 that hasn't already been said? [Insert Half-Life 3 and Valve Can't Count Past 2 Joke Here]

Half-Life 2 - это одна из моих самых любимых игр, что же получилось у Valve на этот раз? Разработчики выучились на своих же ошибках и смогли сделать игру еще более осмысленной и детальной, чего стоит только новая физическая модель и отличная проработка локаций. Присутствует более интригующая и мрачная атмосфера, пожалуй, это в первую очередь заслуга художников-мультипликаторов. Ругать игру просто не получается, если только за ее продолжительность, но здесь уже палка о двух концах. Предыдущая игра студии проходилась мной десятки раз, уверен, что и это творение я буду пробегать еще далеко не единожды. Рекомендую всем, это
произведение искусства и шедевр игровой индустрии. 10/10

P.S. Есть ещё и глубокий подтекст, который полностью раскрывает себя в концовке.
Alan insanın pişman olması İMKANSIZ hikaye efso,oynanış mükemmel,ne ararsanız var ALMANIZI YÜKSEK ŞEKİLDE TAVSİYE EDERİM

This is possibly the best version of the Half-Life franchise. It shows just how deep the game can go with character and story development. (SPOILER) When you get to the large roads that span for a long time, you get a really basic tutorial on how to drive the buggy. They don't explicitly say it, but you know what they are trying to do. This game was significantly ahead of the gaming industry at the time. If you changed the textures for some higher resolution ones and added better shading, you would have a game that could come out today and still be top tier.
This is the best game holy shit
pretty great game - gravity gun is awesome but the part with the striders is annoying and you should keep running past when you can

Very fun, kind of buggy, but you can just play the Half-Life 2 Update to avoid them. The combat is fun, and playing with the Gravity Gun is cool, but sometimes the game is confusing, but you will eventually figure it out.

Half Life 2, meus amigos, que jogo bom, todo mundo dizia que esse jogo era bom, confesso que quando fui jogar não esperava muita coisa mas esse jogo me surpreendeu, a história é interessante e prende o jogador, (parece que você ta em um filme de ação misturado com star wars kkkk é uma doideira) considerando a época que ele foi lançado, a física e a IA são muito boas, os gráficos são muito lindos e a jogabilidade é muito fluída, nem parece um jogo de 2004, além do jogo ser bom, ele é muito grande, odeio comprar um jogo e zerar em 3 horas, com Half Life eu não tive esse problema, recomendo pra qualquer um que goste do gênero FPS, porque esse daqui é o meu preferido.

Obs: Não sei se teremos Half Life 3, afinal a Valve não sabe contar até 3 kkkk
You know what? this game does deserve the title as best FPS of all time.

Half-Life 2, vaya, es un juego que marco un antes y un después en sus años, en mi opinión uno de los mejores juegos de la historia, una secuela que supera a su antecesor y que nos introduce a una historia y atmósfera completamente diferente a la del primer juego. Si estas buscando un juegazo antiguo con gráficos decentes y que cuenta con una muy buena historia y un extenso "Lore", déjame decirte que este es el indicado. Y si tienes pensado comprar todo los HALF-LIFE. Pues, QUE ESTAS ESPERANDO!? DO IT!

Hands down the best FPS I have ever played till this day! The story, characters, atmosphere, music and gameplay are second to none! This game is a classic and every PC gamer needs to experience this epic masterpiece, I cannot recommend it enough 10/ 10.
The best part is easily Gordon Freeman's charismatic dialogue
